intro: Quercus yingjiangensis, commonly known as the Yingjiang oak, is a rare and endemic species native to China. It is a deciduous tree characterized by its distinctive acorns and lobed leaves. The plant belongs to the Fagaceae family, which includes oaks, chestnuts, and beeches. It typically grows in mountainous regions with a temperate climate. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a valuable subject for botanical research and conservation efforts.
